title: How to Cook Trout Recipe
description: This fresh trout recipe is seasoned, broiled, and served with the simplest butter-lemon sauce for a weeknight meal that couldn't be easier or quicker.

115 Reviews 26 Photos This trout recipe is so simple, it doesn't even have a name. I just call it Trout. This is such an easy weeknight seafood dinner. It's a really nice way to cook fish, especially if you're new at cooking it. By John Mitzewich John Mitzewich John Mitzewich — aka Chef John — has produced more than 1,500 cooking videos for Allrecipes. He's the actor, director, and screenwriter whose hands and voice confidently walk you through techniques. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 26 26 26 26 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings ¼ cup butter 2 (8 ounce) whole trout, butterflied and deboned salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste 2 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice 2 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley Directions Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-low heat until butter smells toasted and is golden brown, about 1 minute. Turn off heat. Stacy Allen Line a baking sheet with a piece of aluminum foil. Place trout onto foil; open trout so skin sides are down. Drizzle each trout with about 1/2 teaspoon melted butter. Generously season with salt and black pepper. Move an oven rack to 5 or 6 inches below the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler on high heat. Broil trout until opaque and barely firm to the touch, 2 or 3 minutes. Remove from oven. Stacy Allen Return pan of remaining melted butter over high heat; stir in lemon juice and parsley. Bring butter sauce to a boil; whisk to combine. Stacy Allen Serve trout on plates and drizzle with butter sauce. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 310 home cooks made it! This recipe is so simple and very delicious. I made it with the Kale, Quinoa, and Avocado Salad w/Lemon Dijon Vinaigrette recipe which was also perfect (doing review next). Thanks again for a recipe very well done! 04 of 26 Photo by  atreyu 01/09/2021 So simple, and so delicious! I steamed some vegetables and then tossed them in the pan with the remaining seasoned butter for a delectable side. 05 of 26 Photo by  LaRainey Rainey 02/24/2020 It turned out okay. I made the recipe accordingly but I should have adjusted the amount due to I only had two trouts filet and not two whole trouts. It was a little bit to much lemon juice. I will definitely try and remake this dish. I will half the ingredients. Also I tried what the lady suggested about the skin, it did not work. 06 of 26 Photo by  Rebecca Spence 01/25/2020 07 of 26 Photo by  Liz 08/04/2019 I am not very good in the kitchen and have never made trout before. This recipe is so easy and it was good!! I added oregano and rosemary to season the fillets before cooking. I also added garlic to the butter sauce. I think next time I will add more lemon - just my taste preference. Instead of baking, I wrapped in foil and grilled 3-5min each side. 08 of 26 Photo by  Denise Cason 01/30/2019 09 of 26 Photo by  Ms Claus 01/10/2019 No substitutions. Simply delicious as is. 10 of 26 Photo by  Gay 11/11/2018 Excellent.
